Reviews.Content: Loved the Sunsets       Sunset from our lanai at DHB Hotel
Reviews.Author: VacationingTexan

Reviews.Content: overrated penthouse is NOT a penthouse, no rooms with direct oceanfront view, very small unit, no beach access, tiny lawn, no BBQ or any amenities and unfriendly staff and incompetent manager of unit who charged us $25 for his mistake and was out of the state with no back up support for guest issues.
Reviews.Author: DOLPHINWATCH

Reviews.Content: the pictures were a lie! Glad we only stayed just one night. The pictures made it look fairly decent BUT: only one wall was re-painted; the beds were so old that you were really just sleeping on the wire coils and the website made it seem like you would get at least two queens but we only got two doubles; old, disgusting bedding with bed bugs; outdated fixtures especially in the bathroom; a window without shade in the bathroom, and a tv not worth turning on. The individual A/C was new, there was a decent sized fridge, new furniture and art hanging on the walls, the lobby area was nice, and the place was fairly secure but don't let the Bath  Body Works shampoo/bar soap nor the 8am breakfast knock on the door get you to pay too much for this place. Especially since it's a decent walk from most of the Waikiki action (which is both bad and good).
Reviews.Author: geegster

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointing I made reservations on line after seeing the rooms and felt I was getting a good deal. I was expecting two double bed and found that there was only one bed so our son had to sleep on the floor. The carpets were stained and filthy. The room was generally dirty. The trash was never emptied in the three days we were there. I had to ask twice for replacement for coffee. The view and location were great- Diamond Head out the back and a great view of Wakiki on the other side. Even though there was a desk at the resort , it did not service the room. There was an older person who eveidently lived in the next room and kept his door open so we had to walk right by it and I had the feeling I was living in a senior living apartment....I felt like it was a bait and switch--will never stay at a Marc Resort again...It would be better to invest more and be better satisfied--after all it is Hawaii.
Reviews.Author: Vacationlover74

Reviews.Content: A Little More than a Yawn Details: Priceline reservation- $125/nite. [If using Priceline never give a rate over $100. That is the asking price, unless high season?] Room 502. Hotel room with small refrigerator only. Parking $17/day.Check-in: Would not let me check in earlier than 3:00pm. The 鈥渇ob鈥?for the parking garage did not work; was quickly resolved. Other than that, non-eventful.Room: The room was clean and comfortable. There is no balcony. A window looks out on top of the next door building鈥檚 roof and other apartments. No view of the ocean. Same for the entry way. Across the way is another residence building 鈥?where you can even wave and say hello to your 鈥渘eighbors鈥? The mattress was very comfortable and 鈥渆ncouraged鈥?restful sleep. It really felt great. The television鈥檚 remote control did not work. A call to the front desk did not produce any results. This is a hotel residence building. A portion is reserved for guests. A laundry room is in the garage but I鈥檓 not sure if guests can use it. You may want to inquire if reserving. The strongest point for this hotel was the bed and that it is located away from the Waikiki Beach area. It is quieter in this area. The hotel has a beautiful patio and backyard area [no beach] that overlooks the ocean. Nothing else going for it 鈥?no bells and whistles - thus it鈥檚 common low rating.
Reviews.Author: gstabc

Reviews.Content: Hibiscus Suite is awesome Stayed at Diamond Head Beach Hotel in 2007 NOVEMBER. Was a little worried due to the past reviews, but found the staff to be present and helpful. Front desk not only gave us directions, but also gave us detailed maps of places we wanted to go. Our room was on the third floor and it offered the best view. Parking before 6pm is only 25 cents an hour. ****My only complaint is all the MEN around, but that had nothing to do with the hotel.****
Reviews.Author: Bulletgreen

Reviews.Content: Not as bad as they say Although previous reviews mentioned the front desk's hours are 8:30am-6:00pm, it seems as if another management has taken over the front desk. They are now open from 6:00am-10:00pm.The location is amazing. I was informed by the person at the front desk that they have renovated many of the rooms. If you are expecting top-notch rooms, this is not the place for you. The rooms are very nice for this sort of condo-hotel.They do have parking available, and there is also plenty of metered parking outside which is free from 6pm-10am.It isnt as bad as it seems.
Reviews.Author: daisuki143

Reviews.Content: Location, location, location.... I booked my stay at the Diamond Head Beach hotel through VRBO. I found the room to be exactly as it was pictured through the VRBO website. Most rooms at this hotel are privately owned and decorated. I called the owner to make sure I wouldn't have the experience of the bait and switch review. Thankfully, I was assured I wouldn't. To be sure, I called the rental company a couple of days before to get the lock box number and was told no problem. If you are looking for action, this isn't the place to stay. It is quiet and peaceful. The view from the lawn sun area is amazing. I sat and read, went for a swim in the ocean, and felt like I was a Hawaii resident. It was wonderful. You are within walking distance to the action in Waikiki. I walked it each day. Our view was of Diamond Head and Kapiolani park. Would I stay here again? Yes, for the feel of Hawaii, and the peace and quiet.
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A

Reviews.Content: Beware bait and switch if purportedly renting from a condo owner I rented a room for 5 nights, dealing directly with the condo owner through VRBO.com. His unit had recently been renovated and was nicely furnished, with room to sleep 4 (2 adults and 2 little kids on a queen bed and convertible sofabed) as I had requested. I arrived after a full day of travel and was shown a run-down room with only one bed for 2 people. I was not happy.Though individually owned, the condo was managed by Marc Resorts, and they switched me from the unit I rented (which was specifically noted on the reservation) to the dump they showed me for some reason that they couldn't explain and couldn't remedy because someone else was already in the unit I had rented and was staying for another 2 weeks. The compromise solution was to put me in yet another unit that did sleep 4 (just barely--on two double beds with ill-fitting sheets) but was also pretty run-down. This accommodation came only after considerable pressure put to Marc Resorts and the owner of the unit I rented.I knew that the Diamond Head Beach Hotel was a property of individually owned condos of varying quality, but thought to escape the bad experiences of some others by getting a specific unit. Apparently my mistake. I did press for some compensation for my considerable troubles and got a 20% discount/refund, which took away some of the bad feelings. The location is ideal for families, close to the beach, park, and the bustle of Waikiki if you want it, but without the noise and general clamor. The next time I'm there, I will check out hotels in the same general vicinity (the New Otani looked nice and reasonably priced), but will definitely avoid the Diamond Head Beach Hotel.
Reviews.Author: ipwatcher

Reviews.Content: Stay Somewhere ELSE This is not the place to stay at all. The staff can't even tell you where the nearest resturant, grocery store or anything else is. We found out on our own that a bus stop was about 200 feet away, but the guy at the desk couldn't tell us that. The elevator was broke one of the days we were there and when we asked the same guy when it would be fixed, he said I called the repair man that is all I can do. The place is very old and the only way to get to the water is to trespass on the next door neighbors property. Forget about parking there, they only have 8 spaces! You will have to feed a meter across the street if you are lucky enough to get a space .Don't expect any help from the young man who sits at the desk with the stupid grin on his face !!!!! You can not get the water in the sink to run cold so you can get a drink of water. My advice go somewhere else. We were going on a cruise and decided to stay in Oahu 2 days before we got on the ship, and this so called hotel ruined our first time in Hawaii. Run, don't walk to another HOTEL, ANY HOTEL!
Reviews.Author: mbbpnut

Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money The only good thing going for the Diamond Beach Hotel is the location..quiet end of Waikiki. Now for the problems..the room was dirty. Needed paint, the carpet was filthy. The staff could not answer any basic questions ( where is the closest bus etc.) There are no views below the 6th floor. Marc Hotels only owns 22 rooms in the complex, most below the 6th floor. The parking is impossible. If you are lucky to get reserved parking, you pay $12 per day for the privilege. Everytime we passed the reception area, there was a guest complaining about the hotel. Pass on this hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! This is NOT a hotel - it is a timeshare that people rent out. We stayed in room 205 and it was the most disgusting place in which I have stayed in many, many years. Filthy tile, smelled like mold, dark, dank. Just awful. We would have complained but there was no one to complain to! The desk was not staffed. At some point we did get maid service, but even that was sub-par. You can do so much better! Be warned!
Reviews.Author: BridgetF

Reviews.Content: rooms are fine -- hotel services terrible  We have stayed at the hotel about 8 times over a period of 30 years. It used to be top rank. However, now 50% of the rooms have been converted to Condos.The hotel has undergone considerable renovation, and for the most part the facilities are excellent. The location is outstanding; far enough away from Waikiki to avoid the masses, but close enough to walk and shop the strip. We keep going back because of the locataion. If you're lucky enough to be able to get a guest membership at the Outrigger Canoe club, its only a couple of doors down the street.Now for the bad part. The hotel services currently are terrible. The front desk is only open from 8:30AM to 6:00PM. If you need help at other hours, lots of luck. Also, even during the day, the front desk is often un-attended, since the help is off somewhere doing other duties. One guest we talked to, tried to check-in after hours and it took her 1 hour, using an outside line for information.The maid service is sub-standard. They took at best only 5 minutes to clean the room each day. About all they did was make the beds. Very poor.So, we might go back again since we love the locatation and the rates are fair, but if you are looking for a place to stay where the hotel services are ok, don't go here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Diamond in the ruft Stayed in a one bedroom suite #1401, AWESOME views - the property itself has a great ambience about it - the building itself is quite old - but hey, so is about 90 percent of Waikiki hotel condo properties. Some renovations were going on, but I didn't mind, because they are only bettering the hotel - if they weren't we'd just be complaining as to why? don't they renovate.My family and I had wonderful and memorable time at this hotel, will return in a heartbeat - if you love nostalgia, this is the place to stay - Aloha
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Bad experience Under construction, located next to condos whose neighbors had to shush the party in the room next to mine, mediocre service. When I complained about my room setup (microwave next to bathroom), I was told it was a condo in the hotel pool and that's how the owners designed it and they couldn't rearrange my room. Noisy surf instructors hanging around property. Great oceanfront lawn but next time I'll stay where I can relax.
Reviews.Author: ontheroad

Reviews.Content: Noisy guests, rundown hotel Had some relatives stay there for a few weeks and spent some time there with them, and it's pretty bad. The hotel's run down, and a lot of the rooms are condo/hotel which means they're owned by individuals  just put into the hotel rental pool, so there's not much quality control. The other guests are often rowdy, and they act like they're at a big resort instead of a quiet little spot --where everyone can hear everything. Also, the front desk closes before 5:00 and there's no way to get problems solved unless it's something the security guard can do.
Reviews.Author: hawaiichick

Reviews.Content: Unbelievable Views The views from the penthouse are unbelievable. Centrally located in Honolulu. Great surfing right behind the hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July of 2004. On the 9th floor it was not only beautiful but so much quieter and less congested than the other hotels. The view was breathtaking and even in July, it was chilly on our private balcony. Very windy, but a very nice change with the daytime highs of around 90. A couple of doors down, we were pleasantly surprised to see a very well known actor staying there. Very nice man. We found Lynette, one of the clerks to be very friendly and personable. The rest of them could use a class in congeniality. There were also many restaurants that delivered to our door. Nice since we were exhausted from the 10 hr plane trip. The pictures of the water front is misrepresented. There is no beach, only a seawall that you have to climb down to reach the water. No sand whatsoever plus a ocean floor more like a river. Way too many rocks close to shore. We were able to get the basement parking and we were very pleased with that arrangement. No housekeeping until afternoon, but we are late sleepers so all worked out great. The only renovations when we were there were them painting the hotel doors. Never woke us up. Would I go back? You bet!! In about 10 years when we finally get rested up again.:)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Blatant Misprepresentation/Run down property in the process of being renovated The Marc Resorts website showcases this hotel as a premier beachfront property. The photos of the property were misreprentated...When we arrived there is no place to park...the lobby was run down, no receptionist and we had to ring a bell for service.The check in clerk was very apologetic and informed us that the property is in the process of being remodeled and the website portrays the future look of the property..at no time while making the reservations was I advised that the hotel was undergoing renovations....I was able to get a refund but the aggravation of having to scramble for another hotel room after enduring a 14hr flight from the mainland could have been avoided...Best to avoid this property until all renovations are complete..
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation there! This hotel was just what we wanted. Nice staff,location was great and the room was clean and comfortable.We like to avoid Waikiki and still be close to town.I am a former Hawaii resident and I liked the local atmosphere there.We will stay there again next year.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hated the Diamond Head beach Hotel Condo Diamond Head Beach Hotel is an old run down property that is marketed with brochures that truly don't represent its present condition. It is very low priced and if that is your only consideration, it would work for you.The brochure says that there is basement parking(fee). They don't say it is limited and may not be available to you when you arrive. That is what happened to us. We were told we could park a few blocks away and had to move the car or feed the meters after 9:00 A.M.When we contacted Aloha Beach Vacation Rentals the owner became quite antagnostic and says she never guaranteed any parking even though the brochure said there was basement parking. She refused to make any adjustment in the price which was prepaid. We left the place never having used it because it is not a vacation when you have to feed meters while you want to be on the beach.In addition, the unit was old, small and didn't have the Large Lanai indicated in the advertising materials. Clearly, this was costly mistake for us and could have ruined our entire trip to Hawaii if we would have allowed it to. I would strongly suggest someone look elsewhere especially if you are bringing with children.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great location During xmas 2003, our AAA travel agent booked our stay @ Pleasant Hawaiian's Ohana Reef Towers in Waikiki...the room was DIRTY, the hotel was extremely run down and the staff was not pleasant nor helpful and no matter which floor you were in, the noise level was awful...during xmas week, all hotels were sold out but we were lucky and a local referred us to the Diamond Head Beach Hotel At a rate of $131. Weary of publication versus actual hotel conditions, the manager-Susan held our reservation and let us see the room before confirming. Needless to say, the standard room and the hotel was pleasantly clean, located near Waikiki without the traffic, noise, and people. The only downside is that we had to park across the street at Kapiolani Park ($0.25/hr at 4 hour max) and daily maid service in late afternoons. Having said that, I would still come back and stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great views if high, variable service, good value if less than $125. We moved here after 2 noisy nights at Aqua Bambooon Kuhio Avenue. We got a price of $111 per night, but this was only available as they were renovating - but note noise started only at 9am (Aqua Bamboo all night).The size of the room was good and kitchen was very well stocked - even with things like salt and pepper, some herbs etc. But be aware that this hotel is a bit odd - it is run by Marc, but I was told the rooms were owned by individuals so there is a lot of variation in decor etc. Views are fantastic - with the wardrobe mirror reflecting Diamond Head and the park- you get almost 270 degrees as you look directly down Waikiki. Through kitchen windowyou have further views - but get a high floor - above 7 or so.Ground floor rooms would be absolutely awful with everyonewalking past and no views on lower floors.Full price of this room was $186 - not worth this.Some reviews and residents suggest Diamond Head is middle ofnowhere - its 10 minutes walk ot the start of Waikiki - I think too many Americans have forgotten how to walk. It is very pleasant and quiet around here, so I would definitely head to this end again. Parking really easy and straight forward drive down to Kahala to enjoy dinner at the Mandarin and out to the east of the island.Service here was mixed - some really poor service given - ask for safe key, none available, none supplied. Ask for telephone card - locked up 1 minute before - get it tomorrow, when wanted that evening to make international calls.
Reviews.Author: dubainick
